intro: Zizania microstachya, commonly known as narrow-stalked菰, is a species of grass native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stalks and small, clustered spikelets that bear both male and female flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and the edges of ponds. Its rhizomes are edible and have been historically used by Indigenous peoples for food and medicinal purposes. Zizania microstachya plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
